posts._title: Jonathan Kahana – The Documentary Film Reader: History, Theory, Criticism (2016)
posts.title: The Documentary Film Reader: History, Theory, Criticism
posts.excerpt: History, Theory, Criticism Edited by Jonathan Kahana and Foreword by Charles Musser Provides the most comprehensive overview of documentary film assembled to date, with over 100 articles on myriad topics Features a substantial main introduction and section introductions throughout to establish key contexts and important critical issues Ranges widely across continents, filmmakers, and subgenres, addressing …

posts.title: Lotte
posts.excerpt: Lotte is impulsive, rough around the edges and leads a colourful life on the streets of Berlin, stumbling from man to man and flat to flat. One night in her local bar she bumps into Marcel, an almost forgotten acquaintance. Just after he recognises her Lotte takes flight, finding refuge in the flat of her …

posts._title: Leyla Bouzid – À peine j’ouvre les yeux AKA As I Open My Eyes (2015)
posts.title: À peine j’ouvre les yeux
posts.excerpt: Tunis, summer 2010, a few months before the Revolution: Farah, 18 years-old, has just graduated and her family already sees her as a future doctor. But she doesn’t think the same way. She sings in a political rock band. She has a passion for life, gets drunk, discovers love and her city by night against …

posts.title: Kate Plays Christine
posts.excerpt: Actress Kate Lyn Sheil prepares to portray the role of Christine Chubbuck, a real-life news reporter who took her own life on national television in 1974. rogerebert.com wrote: Movie publicity is filled with buzzwords about acting, “transformation” in particular, but it’s sad how little practical information we viewers get about that process. It’s often wrapped …

posts.title: Homeland (Iraq Year Zero)
posts.excerpt: Quote: What would you do if the world’s most fearsome military presence threatened to invade where you live? How does one even begin to prepare for that kind of assault? In “Homeland (Iraq Year Zero),” Baghdad-situated filmmaker Abbas Fahdel offers world audiences an extraordinary opportunity to identify with the “enemy” in the Iraq War — …

posts._title: Kaige Chen – Jing Ke ci Qin Wang AKA The Emperor and the Assassin [+extra] (1998)
posts.title: Jing Ke ci Qin Wang
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Set in 221 BC, The Emperor and the Assassin tells of Ying Zheng (Li Xuejian) and his obsession to unite seven Chinese kingdoms and become the first Emperor of China. The film mixes spectacular battle scenes with court intrigue, counterpointed by the King’s complex relationship with the only woman he has truly loved, the …

posts.title: Bachelor Mother
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Polly Parrish, a clerk at Merlin’s Department Store, is mistakenly presumed to be the mother of a foundling. Outraged at Polly’s unmotherly conduct, David Merlin becomes determined to keep the single woman and “her” baby together.

posts.title: Tertium non datur
posts.excerpt: Quote: It is the end of the Romanian war against the Soviet Union (but not the end of the WWII), as Germany and Romania are allies, but in a few weeks they will be enemies. Two German officers stop for a lunch with a group of Romanian officers and as the story develops, a pair …

posts.title: Divines
posts.excerpt: A street teenager from a dysfunctional family from a banlieue (HLMs) in Paris comes across a young dancer who turns her life upside down. Isabel Stevens (Sight & Sound) wrote: From the opening credits – a grainy breakneck tour of the lives of two teenage girls who lark about, posing and dancing via vertical-aspect cameraphone …

posts._title: Slobodan Sijan – Maratonci trce pocasni krug AKA The Marathon Family (1982)
posts.title: Maratonci trce pocasni krug
posts.excerpt: Quote: Sometimes handling the dead can be almost as difficult as handling the living, according to the Topalovic family and its many members — from great-grandparents on down. They are losing ground in the fight to keep their cemetery business from going under and have had to make a clandestine alliance with n’er-do-well entrepreneurs that …
